channel.title: Runeshock Resting | Day-Night Vice-versa
channel.description:
I thought this was a cool concept, will be adding a resting timer as well. I assure you it won't be that quick. Will implement day-night support.
Resting will be available all over Runeshock, it will give you a temporary boost to statistics like regular potions and will replenish your health. Energy will be replenished depending on how long you rest for, every second that goeas by will replenish 4 energy, so it will take 25 seconds from 0-100%. Same goes toward the boosting of statistics and heath but your statistics restore like a restore potion and gain 1 point extra per 3 seconds. Giving you a wonderful interactive game-play with objects and usefulness of objects.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SaRZOB_QgRo
He actually lies down on the bench. Will have bed support etc.

item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

[quote=“KroniKz_, post:7, topic:539098”][quote author=enzo42 link=topic=657933.msg4401054#msg4401054 date=1390661572]
Who sleeps on a bench outside

Concept is cool though
[/quote]
what do you expect him to make a full neighborhood for each player to sleep in?
god you guys are so critical…

Nice job, this is cool.[/quote]

Haha, thanks!

artem543:

Having energy restored.

Most definitely!

item.title: Runeshock Resting | Day-Night Vice-versa
item.dc:creator: @Encryption Encryption
item.description:
@Encryption wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:5, topic:539098”]I like the idea.
You could put a bench outside of the Lumbridge castle, and when you die you respawn laying down on the bench. Perhaps even the ability to upgrade to a bed in the Lumbridge castle after completing a quest of some sort.[/quote]

I could change the spawn point on death to many locations all over Runeshock that have a bed, but he’d have the getting up emote. although I’m thinking duel arena would be a good area for death spawn because of the amount of beds, or maybe just have it for duel arena. Thanks for the feedback.

Read full topic
